title: Poster, "Yankee Flame for Mobil, America: The Third Century", 1976
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed: Imprinted in black below image lower right: America: the third century. Imprinted in black Imprinted in black below title: Yankee Flame by Ben Schonzeit: From a series commissioned by Mobil Oil Corporation for the Bicentennial. Recogonized by the American Revolution Bicentennial Administration. Imprinted in black at lower left corner: Mobil above a star logo encircled by the text: American Revolution Bicentennial 1776-1976.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: A large full color photographic reproduction of a glass of soda with ice cubes, rendered in saturated reds, blues, yellows and greens. The image is shown in sharp focus, very close up. Behind, against a red background and slightly out of focus are George Washington at left and the Statue of Liberty at right. Beaded drops of moisture are scattered around the glass. Image bordered in white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Yankee Flame for Mobil, America: The Third Century", 1976.
1976. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-263.
